column4: if that shows no result, try a cd /home and then ls -l and look at the perms, ran into similar last week
hosstest , all ppl, plz stop  sending ppl there, like asking questions in a graveyard,,, thats why i'm educating myself on wine, so i  can help others,,,  that place is dead 75% of the time
have you run the memtest?
yes I have, the machine functions just fine with other operating systems (including a different distro of linux, freebsd, windows xp, sun xvm server, and windows vista)
just a thought, hrm...
how did you install? full-guided, manual, etc.   ?
i'm trying to install from the standard gui desktop
from live cd then?
right
have you tried the alternate cd?
no i'm trying to identify the driver issue that exists on the livecd with my configuration.
is this a desktop or laptop, what version- 8.04 or 8.10? ,
desktop, basic specs listed in the message, 8.10
i dont know if this will help you, but did me,,, on the grub menu i edited the kernel line (and later the menu.lst) ... add:  noapic apic=none  to the kernel line
yes, i'm looking for a way to determine the specific problem I am having
well, wouldnt hurt to try that and see, hope it helps, sorry i dont know more
it is going to help.  i'm trying to figure out what caused it to stop working in 8.10 as opposed to 8.04
i'm with ya there bro, thats why i'm still on 8.04 ;-)
works fine after it's installed, i'm trying to find out how to gather enough information to file a good bug report
ahhh, ok, well i cant help there, i'm sticking with 8.04 for a bit longer
it means you have a hardware problem or incompatibility with the livecd.  use the alternate install disc
ok,, i may do that, just told 8.04 to upgrade, we'll see how that goes first, but already have had error (minor)
